verses.verse: Then I returned <S%H7725><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> all the oppressions <S%H6217><s%> that are done <S%H6213><s%> under the sun: <S%H8121><s%> and behold, <S%H1832><s%> the tears of those who were oppressed, <S%H6231><s%> and they had no comforter; <S%H5162><s%> and on the side <S%H3027><s%> of their oppressors <S%H6231><s%> there was power; <S%H3581><s%> but they had no comforter. <S%H5162><s%>
Therefore I praised <S%H7623><s%> the dead <S%H4191><s%> who have been <S%H3528><s%> long dead <S%H4191><s%> more than the living <S%H2416><s%> who are yet <S%H5728><s%> alive. <S%H2416><s%>

Yes, <S%H2896><s%> better than them both <S%H8147><s%> is him who has not yet <S%H5728><s%> been, <S%H7200><s%> who has not seen the evil <S%H7451><s%> work <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> under the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

Then I saw <S%H7200><s%> all the labor <S%H5999><s%> and <S%H3788><s%> achievement <S%H4639><s%> that is the envy <S%H7068><s%> of a man <S%H376><s%>'s neighbor. <S%H7453><s%> This also is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
The fool <S%H3684><s%> folds <S%H2263><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> together <S%H2263><s%> and ruins <S%H398><s%> himself. <S%H1320><s%>

Better <S%H2896><s%> is a handful, <S%H3709><s%> with quietness, <S%H5183><s%> than two <S%H2651><s%> handfuls <S%H4393><s%> with labor <S%H5999><s%> and chasing <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
Then I returned <S%H7725><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> vanity <S%H1892><s%> under the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

There is <S%H3426><s%> one <S%H259><s%> who is alone, <S%H8145><s%> and he has neither son <S%H1121><s%> nor brother. <S%H251><s%> There is no end <S%H7093><s%> to all of his labor, <S%H5999><s%> neither are his eyes <S%H5869><s%> satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with wealth. <S%H6239><s%> "For whom then, <S%H6001><s%> do I labor, and deprive <S%H2637><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> of enjoyment? <S%H2896><s%>" This also is vanity. <S%H1892><s%> Yes, <S%H7451><s%> it is a miserable business. <S%H6045><s%>
Two <S%H8147><s%> are better <S%H2896><s%> than one, <S%H259><s%> because they have <S%H3426><s%> a good <S%H2896><s%> reward <S%H7939><s%> for their labor. <S%H5999><s%>

For if they fall, <S%H5307><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> will lift up <S%H6965><s%> his fellow; <S%H2270><s%> but woe <S%H337><s%> to him who is alone <S%H259><s%> when he falls, <S%H5307><s%> and doesn't <S%H8145><s%> have another to lift him up. <S%H6965><s%>
Again, <S%H1571><s%> if two <S%H8147><s%> lie together, <S%H7901><s%> then they have warmth; <S%H2552><s%> but how can one <S%H259><s%> keep warm alone? <S%H3179><s%>

If a man <S%H259><s%> prevails <S%H8630><s%> against one who is alone, <S%H8147><s%> two shall withstand <S%H5975><s%> him; <S%H8027><s%> and a threefold cord <S%H2339><s%> is not quickly <S%H4120><s%> broken. <S%H5423><s%>

Better <S%H2896><s%> is a poor <S%H4542><s%> and wise <S%H2450><s%> youth <S%H3206><s%> than an old <S%H2205><s%> and foolish <S%H3684><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> who doesn't <S%H3045><s%> know how to receive admonition any more. <S%H2094><s%>
For out of prison <S%H631><s%> he came <S%H3318><s%> forth to be king; <S%H4427><s%> yes, <S%H4438><s%> even in his kingdom he was born <S%H3205><s%> poor. <S%H7326><s%>

I saw <S%H7200><s%> all the living <S%H2416><s%> who walk <S%H1980><s%> under the sun, <S%H8121><s%> that they were with the youth, <S%H3206><s%> the other, <S%H8145><s%> who succeeded him. <S%H5975><s%>

There was no end <S%H7093><s%> of all the people, <S%H5971><s%> even of all them over whom he was <S%H6440><s%>â€”yet those who come after <S%H314><s%> shall not rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in him. <S%H1892><s%> Surely this also is vanity and a chasing <S%H7475><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
